followup-action.name: Show Initial Work Items
followup-action.description: Runs a query which displays any assigned work items.

followup-action.name: Setup Project
followup-action.description: Initializes a project area with the pieces necessary to start work on a project.

workspace.name: ${stream-name} Workspace
workspace.description: Initial repository workspace for the creator of ${stream-name} Stream

category.htmlDescription: Category for all not further specified work items.

workitem.htmlDescription:
Define an iteration plan

To define an iteration plan for your team area:

1. Open the Team Artifacts view and expand the node corresponding to your connected project area.

2. Right-click the Plans node, select New->Iteration Plan, and complete the wizard.

For additional details on defining iteration plans using the Iteration Plan wizard, consult the
Getting Started with Iteration Planning help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

Define a new build

To define a new build for your team area:

1. Open the Team Artifacts view and expand the node corresponding to your connected project area.

2. Right-click the Builds node and select New Build Definition and follow the prompts in the wizard.

For additional details on defining build definitions using the Build Definition wizard, consult the
Getting Started with setting up Jazz Builds help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

workitem.summary: Share code with Jazz Source Control
workitem.htmlDescription:
Share code with Jazz Source Control

To share code in your Eclipse workspace with the Jazz stream created during process initialization:

1. Select a project you wish to share, right-click and select Team->Share Project...

2. In the Share Project Wizard, select Jazz Source Control and select Next.

3. If you have more than one unshared project in your workspace, you will be given the chance to select other projects to share. On the Projects page, select any additional projects you wish to share and select Next.

4. If you have more than one repository connection, you will be prompted to choose one. On the Jazz Repository page, select the repository in which you created your project area and select Next.

5. On the Select Component page, you should see a repository workspace prefixed with the name of the project area you created.

Expand this repository workspace and you will see a component. Select this component and select Next. Review the ignored resources on the next page and then select Finish to share your code with the specified component and repository workspace.

6. Now that the code has been shared to your repository workspace, you need to deliver it from your workspace to the stream created during initialization of the process. To do this, open the Pending Changes view.

7. In the Pending Changes view, you should see one outgoing change from your repository workspace. Right-click on the repository workspace and select Deliver to deliver your code to the stream associated with your team area.

For additional details on using Jazz Source Control, consult the
Getting Started with Jazz Source Control help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

Define iterations

When the project area was initialized, an initial timeline "Development" was created. Within the timeline a hierarchy of iterations has been created for you.

To edit, delete, duplicate or add additional timelines and iterations:

1. Open the Project Area Editor by right-clicking on the project area in the Team Artifacts or Team Organization view and selecting Open.

2. Go to the Timelines section in the editor. To create a new iteration, use either the Create Iteration... action or the Duplicate... action on an existing iteration.

3. To define the start and end dates for an existing iteration, use the Edit Properties... action on an existing iteration.

For additional details on using Jazz Team Process, consult the
Getting Started with Projects, Teams, and Process help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

workitem.summary: Define categories and releases for work items
workitem.htmlDescription:
Define categories and releases for work items. These values will then be available in the work item Categories and Found In fields.

To define the work item categories for the project area:

1. Open the Project Area Editor by right-clicking on the project area in the Team Artifacts or Team Organization view and selecting Open.

2. Go to the Work Item Categories tab.

3. Define categories for work items as well as associate categories with the team areas responsible for the category.

To define the releases to file work items against:

1. Go to the Releases tab of the Project Area Editor.

2. Add some releases to file work items against.

For additional details on using Jazz Work Items, consult the
Getting Started with Work Items help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

Define the team members for the project area as well as the team area

To define team members for a team area or project area:

1. Open the team area or project area editor by right-clicking on the project or team area in the Team Artifacts or Team Organization view and selecting Open.

2. On the Overview page of the editor, there is a Members section. To add a user to the team select the Add button. To create a new user and add them as a member of the team, select the Create button

3. If you clicked Add, in the Add Team Members dialog, select the user(s) you wish to add to your team or project area. If you clicked Create, define the new team member in the Create User wizard.

4. Consider what roles individuals working on your project will assume and what role-specific process should apply to each role. In addition, you will want to consider what permissions to grant to individuals in these roles. For additional details on using Jazz Team Process, consult the
Getting Started with Projects, Teams, and Process help topic.

5. On Save of the editor you will be prompted to send invitations to the newly added team members. This allows you to configure an email invitation that is sent to the new team member. The new team member can accept the invitation with File->Accept Team Invitation.... The invitation will quickly setup their Eclipse workspace to work with the team. At any time you can invite team members to join the team by selecting the team member in the Members section, right click and select Invite to Join Team....

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

workflow.description: This workflow is inspired by the standard Bugzilla workflow and appropriate for defects and tasks.
workflow.name: Default Workflow

query.name: Open created by me
query.description: Work items I have created which are open or in progress

query.name: Closed created by me
query.description: Work items I have created which have been resolved

query.name: Open subscribed by me
query.description: My subscriptions to open or in progress work items

query.name: Closed subscribed by me
query.description: My subscriptions to resolved work items

query.name: Open assigned to me (current milestone)
query.description: To do list for the current milestone

query.name: Pending approvals for me
query.description: Pending requests for approvals or reviews that involve me

Owner does not belong to Team Area

precondition.name: Required Properties
precondition.description: Work items must be Filed Against a specific category and a Summary must be provided so that the team can quickly evaluate who is responsible for the issue.

All change sets should be associated with a work item which is planned for the current iteration.
This makes it easier for the team to track its progress through the iteration and allows other users to understand why your changes were made.
precondition.name: Descriptive Change Sets

followup-action.name: Create Initial Work Items
followup-action.description: Creates an initial set of work items for the user who is invited to the team.

workitem.summary: [Joining a Team] Create a Repository Workspace
workitem.htmlDescription:
Create a Repository Workspace

To create a new repository workspace to work with your new Jazz team:

1. In the Team Artifacts view, expand the My Team Areas node.

2. Open the team area you have joined by double clicking on the team area.

3. Switch to the Links tab of the opened Team Area editor.

4. In the Artifacts section, expand the Source Control node.

5. Right click on the stream and select New -> Repository Workspace....

6. Specify the repository workspace name. Click Next.

7. Click Finish.

You now have a repository workspace loaded with all the components of the team's stream.

For additional details on using Jazz Source Control, consult the
Getting Started with Jazz Source Control help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

workitem.summary: [Joining a Team] Find Your Work Items
workitem.htmlDescription:
Find your work items

When you accepted the invitation to join the team, work items like this one were created for the tasks you need to perform to complete joining the team.

At any time, if you wish to find the work items that are assigned to you, you can use the My Work or Team Central views.

There are also a number of default queries created for you. To browse these queries:

1. Open the Team Artifacts View and expand the node corresponding to the connected project area of the team you just joined.

2. Expand the Work Items node.

3. Expand the Shared Queries node.

4. Expand the Predefined node.

5. Double click on the Open assigned to me query.

The Work Items view will open and display your assigned work items.

For additional details on using Jazz Work Items, consult the
Getting Started with Work Items help topic.

See any terms you don't recognize? You may also wish to consult the Jazz Platform Quick Reference.

workitem.summary: [Joining a Team] Set Up Instant Messaging
workitem.htmlDescription:
Set up instant messaging

To set up instant messaging inside your Jazz client, consult the Connect to a local Sametime or Notes application or Connect to a Jabber server help topics.

followup-action.name: Show Work Items
followup-action.description: Show initial work items created when accepting team invitation.
